com.lsc.ctesterfx.reader

Interface IReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PCSCReader

    public interface IReader
    Interface with a reader.
    Author:
    dma@logossmartcard.com

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect()
      Creates a new connection with the card.
      String getName()
      Returns the name of the reader.
      void release()
      Releases the connection with the card.
      byte[] reset()
      Resets the card and returns the ATR.
      com.lsc.ctesterlib.iso7816.ApduResponse transmit(com.lsc.ctesterlib.iso7816.ApduCommand apdu)
      Transmits the APDU and returns the response.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect()
      throws Exception
        Creates a new connection with the card.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs when connecting to the card.

      • release

        void release()
      throws Exception
        Releases the connection with the card. After calling this method, either connect or reset has to be called to communicate again with the card.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs when releasing the reader.

      • reset

        byte[] reset()
      throws Exception
        Resets the card and returns the ATR.
        Returns:
        ATR of the card. It will never be null unless an exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs resetting the card.

      • transmit

        com.lsc.ctesterlib.iso7816.ApduResponse transmit(com.lsc.ctesterlib.iso7816.ApduCommand apdu)
                                          throws Exception
        Transmits the APDU and returns the response.
        Parameters:
        apdu: - apdu to be transmitted.
        Returns:
        response from the card.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs sending an APDU.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the name of the reader.
        Returns:
        name of the reader.
